Article Name: 2 Unusual Ways Your ‘Picky’ Habits Shape Your Love, By A Psychologist
Description: Is being “picky” leading you closer to intimacy or keeping it out of reach? A new study reveals how these choices play out in modern dating.

Article Name: Hundreds Of Corgis To Return To Pismo Beach For Corgi Nation Vacation
Description: So Cal Corgi Nation joins forces with the Pismo Beach Conference and Visitors Bureau for three days of special events celebrating all things corgi.

Article Name: A Psychologist Shares 1 Completely Overlooked Key To Happiness
Description: Are you constantly on alert and letting suspicion take over? New research shows that a lack of trust could be quietly blocking your chance at happiness.

Article Name: Why Saturday’s Rare ‘Black Moon’ Is A Celestial Milestone For Americans
Description: The new moon on Saturday, Aug. 23, will be a seasonal “black moon” — a rare occurrence when four new moons fall within a single season. It has an intruiging future echo.

Description: Astronomers have detected a black hole, the most massive yet measured, in the Cosmic Horseshoe galaxy.

Article Name: Astrobiologists Still Need A Viable Definition Of Life
Description: To detect extraterrestrial life, astrobiologists first need to get a better handle on how to define life and what it means for a planetary body to be habitable.

Article Name: Don’t Miss Friday’s Six-Planet ‘Parade’ — Here’s How To Watch
Description: August's “planet parade” (also called an alignment) features six planets, four of them visible to the naked eye. Here’s when and where to look on Friday, Aug. 22.

Description: Modern dating has left singles with an overload of options. Here’s two ways that this could be sapping you of your energy.

Article Name: InnovationRx: Phil Knight’s $2 Billion Cancer Gift
Description: In this week’s edition of InnovationRx, we look at Phil Knight’s big cancer gift, Medallion’s credentialing clearinghouse, a new treatment for fibromyalgia, and more.

Article Name: 4 Signs You’re Stuck In A ‘Self-Blame’ Loop, By A Psychologist
Description: Do you keep ruminating and punishing yourself for past mistakes? Research shows it’s your self-blame mindset, not the events themselves, that keeps you trapped.
